Package com.qam2.utils

Class AppointmentManager

java.lang.Object
com.qam2.utils.AppointmentManager
public class AppointmentManager
extends java.lang.Object
Singleton class providing an in memory collection of all Appointments. Provides CRUD operations keeping in memory collection in sync with database. Provides static functions to help facilitate appointment creation and update without overbooking a user, customer, or contact. Provides instance functions to determine whether a Customer has any Appointments and whether or not a logged-in user has an upcoming appointment. Provides instance functions to get Appointments for current: year, month, week, day, customer, user, contact.

    • getInstance

    • filterAppointmentsByYear

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> filterAppointmentsByYear​(java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> appts, int year)
      Gets all Appointments for given year value. Uses Stream API and lambda expression to filter list of Appointments by a given year. The intermediate stream operation filter() takes an implementation of the functional interface Predicate<T> as a parameter. A lambda expression was used to implement Predicate<T> anonymously by providing an implementation of the single abstract method public boolean test(T t1, T t2). The collect terminal operation on the stream uses method references to create an ArrayList and provide methods for adding each item of the stream to ArrayList as well as combine results from possible parallel operations on the same stream.
      Parameters:
      appts - List of Appointments to filter.
      year - Year by which to filter list of Appointments.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Appointments for the given year value.

The collect terminal operation on the stream uses method references to create an ArrayList and provide methods for adding each item of the stream to ArrayList as well as combine results from possible parallel operations on the same stream.
      Parameters:
      appts - List of Appointments to filter.
      month - Month by which to filter list of Appointments.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Appointments for the given month value.

      Gets all Appointments for a given week.
      Parameters:
      appts - List of Appointments to filter.
      lt - The date by which the week is determined, The last Sunday from the given date
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Appointments for a given week.

    • filterAppointmentsByDate

      public static java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> filterAppointmentsByDate​(java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> appts, java.time.LocalDate date)
      Gets all Appointments for a given date. Uses Stream API and lambda expression to filter list of Appointments by a given date. The intermediate stream operation filter() takes an implementation of the functional interface Predicate<T> as a parameter. A lambda expression was used to implement Predicate<T> anonymously by providing an implementation of the single abstract method public boolean test(T t1, T t2). The collect terminal operation on the stream uses method references to create an ArrayList and provide methods for adding each item of the stream to ArrayList as well as combine results from possible parallel operations on the same stream.
      Parameters:
      appts - List of Appointments to filter.
      date - The date by which to filter the list.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Appointments for given date.

    • getAvailableStartTimes

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableStartTimes​(java.lang.String customerName, java.lang.String contactName, java.lang.String userName, java.time.LocalDate date, Appointment appt)
      Get all available Appointment start times for a given set of: customer, contact, user, and date. If an Appointment reference is provided, gets all available times to which the appointment can be changed.
      Parameters:
      customerName - Name of customer.
      contactName - Name of company contact.
      userName - Name of user.
      date - The Appointment date.
      appt - If not null, the Appointment for which all possible times to change to will be calculated.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Strings representing all possible start times for a new or given Appointment.

    • getAvailableEndTimes

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableEndTimes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> availableTimes, java.lang.String start)
      Provides an ArrayList of Strings representing the possible end times for a selected start time.
      Parameters:
      availableTimes - The list of times from which the given start time was selected and possible end times are to be determined.
      start - A start time selected from the given list of available times.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Strings representing all possible end times for given start time.

      public boolean add​(Appointment appointment)
      Adds an Appointment to the Manager's list of Appointments and to the database.
      Parameters:
      appointment - The Appointment to add.
      Returns:
      True if Appointment was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • deleteAllFor

      public boolean deleteAllFor​(Customer c)
      Deletes all Appointments for a given Customer from the Manager's list and the database. Precondition: Customer must have Appointments, consider using hasAppointments() before calling this method.
      Parameters:
      c - The Customer for whom Appointments are to be deleted.
      Returns:
      True if the Customer's Appointments were successfully deleted, false otherwise.

    • getAll

      public java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> getAll()
      Returns:
      A copy of the Manager's list of all appointments.

    • getAppointmentsForCustomer

      public java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> getAppointmentsForCustomer​(int id)
      Gets all Appointments for a given Customer ID. Uses Stream API and lambda expression to filter list of Appointments by a given Customer ID. The intermediate stream operation filter() takes an implementation of the functional interface Predicate<T> as a parameter. A lambda expression was used to implement Predicate<T> anonymously by providing an implementation of the single abstract method public boolean test(T t1, T t2). The collect terminal operation on the stream uses method references to create an ArrayList and provide methods for adding each item of the stream to ArrayList as well as combine results from possible parallel operations on the same stream.
      Parameters:
      id - Customer ID.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Appointments for the given Customer.

    • upcomingAppointment

      public Appointment upcomingAppointment()
      Determines whether the logged-in user has an upcoming Appointment based on Appointment reminder value. Uses Stream API and lambda expressions to filter all Appointments by the current User's ID. The intermediate stream operation filter() takes an implementation of the functional interface Predicate<T> as a parameter. A lambda expression was used to implement Predicate<T> anonymously by providing an implementation of the single abstract method public boolean test(T t1, T t2). The collect terminal operation on the stream uses method references to create an ArrayList and provide methods for adding each item of the stream to ArrayList as well as combine results from possible parallel operations on the same stream.
      Returns:
      True if the logged-in User has an appointment within the time range specified by reminder value, false otherwise.
